==Lyrics==
{| class="wikitable" 
! Lyrics 
! Translation 
|- 
| Quo vadis pater?
| Where are you going father?
|- 
| Ecce luna rubra orta erat
| Lo! A red moon has risen
|-
| Noctem exsanguem rubefecit
| Reddening the bloodless night
|-
| Nemo nisi innocentes dormire potest
| Nobody except the innocents can sleep
|-
| Sors mors est velata 
| Fate is a shrouded death
|-
| Ac sic somnia servabo liberorum<br>(Num unam tantum benedictionem habes, pater nostri?)<br>(Benedicam benedic tibi etiam, pater, somnialiter)
| And this is how I will protect the slumbers of my children<br>(Is this really the only blessing you have, our father?)<ref group="note">Rhetoric question with a negative answer: here the children are hoping that their father might wish something for himself too, instead of focusing entirely on them.</ref><br>(In my sleep I will bless &mdash;and you too bless!&mdash;<ref group="note"> Here the children are urging one another to come bless their father.</ref> you father, too)
|-
| Sors mei finiet etiamsi<br>(Sors immanis et inanis salubris vanitas)<ref group="note">This verse, like the next two, are taken, albeit slightly mixed, from {{w|O Fortuna}}.</ref>
| Even though my fate will be fulfilled<br>(A terrible and vain fate, a benefic lie)
|-
| Haec sors est immanis inanis etiamsi<br>(Semper velata dissolubilis)<ref group="note">Also made by mixing lines from {{w|O Fortuna}}.</ref>
| Even though this fate is terrible and vain<br>(Ever shrouded and fading to nothingness)
|-
| Inane rubeface a luna<br>(Nemo nisi innocentes dormire potest)
| Redden it through a vain moon<br>(Nobody except the innocents can sleep)
|-
| Ecce te nepos excoci sed non quasi argentum elegi 
| Here you are, my heir, I burned away completely, I haven't chosen you as currency
|-
| te {{sic|hide=1}} in patiente camino ut sis paterfamilias eum 
| but to be the head of the family in the patient hearth
|-
| Camini spero vos videre lucem novam<br>(Luce nova)
| I hope you all will see the new light of the hearth<br>(In the new light)
|}
